name: SIG Sauer P238
description: A 'micro-compact' .380 ACP pistol built in the same way as other SIGs, with the added bonus of looking like a very, very small M1911.

name: Glock 42
description: Possibly the most popular pistol in existence.  The Glock is often derided for its plastic construction, but it is easy to shoot. This is a subcompact, slimline .380 ACP model.

name: Glock 25
description: The Glock 25 is a compact .380 ACP model Glock that, because it is manufactured outside the U.S., is only available to law enforcement.

name: Glock 28
description: The Glock 28 is a subcompact .380 ACP model Glock that, because it is manufactured outside the U.S., is only available to law enforcement.

name: Beretta M1934
description: The Beretta Modello 1934 is a compact pistol issued to the Italian Army in World War II that saw extensive use by the Axis, including Italy, Nazi Germany and Romania. It fires the .380 ACP round, known to the Italians as the 9mm Corto, the Italian word for short.

name: Beretta 70 S
description: The Beretta 70 S is a Model 70 with some minor changes and improvements, offered in .22LR, .32 ACP and .380 ACP. This one is in .380 ACP.

name: Beretta 83
description: The Beretta Cheetah 83 is a compact pistol chambered for the .380 ACP cartridge. The 83 features a 7-round single stack magazine while the other .380 ACP models, the 84 and the 85 have a double stack, 13-round capacity and a single stack, 8-round capacity respectively. The 83 also has a slightly longer barrel.

name: Beretta 84
description: The Beretta Cheetah 84 is a compact pistol chambered for the .380 ACP cartridge. The 84 features a 13-round double stack magazine while the other .380 ACP models, the 83 and the 85 have a single stack, 7-round capacity and a single stack, 8-round capacity respectively. The 83 also has a slightly longer barrel.

name: Beretta 85
description: The Beretta Cheetah 85 is a compact pistol chambered for the .380 ACP cartridge. The 85 features an 8-round single stack magazine while the other .380 ACP models, the 84 and the 83 have a double stack, 13-round capacity and a single stack, 7-round capacity respectively. The 83 also has a slightly longer barrel.

name: Beretta 86
description: The Beretta 86 is the fourth pistol in the Cheetah line chambered in .380 ACP but differs substantially from the other three models, the 83, 84 and 85, in that the 86 features a tip-up barrel, requiring the first bullet to be loaded into the barrel instead of racking the slide like a conventional pistol.

name: Beretta Pico
description: The Beretta Pico is an extremely thin and light handgun using the .380 ACP cartridge and was designed for concealed carry and home defense.
